video_description:
The Huawei IDEOS S7 Slim tablet is here. With 3G, WiFi and Bluetooth connectivity options, the S7 Slim is your perfect entertainment and communication companion.

Check out our Facebook page for all the latest updates - www.facebook.com/huaweidevice
title: Huawei IDEOS S7 Slim product demo

comments.text: What is the price?﻿  and when it one sale?

comments.text: When is it on sale﻿ in HK?
comments.author: georgehwong

comments.text: from what i've read on various websites, it will be released sometime in April and it should be between $250-$300. =) plus if anybody says that﻿ this tablet can't have Honeycomb is lying. the developer who made Honeycomb says right out of his own mouth that Honeycomb doesn't have any minimum requirements. so i'm guessing it's up to the company that's producing the tablet to upgrade to Honeycomb
comments.author: Yngjust7

comments.text: So there's a chance that this device may shipped with Honeycom,﻿ right?
comments.author: sopheakize

comments.text: what﻿ about s7 Pro?
comments.author: sopheakize

comments.text: i doubt it would be shipped with Honeycomb but it's possible we can see an update for it in the coming months. I haven't heard/seen too much about the S7 Pro but it's definitely possible. The released specs on the S7 Pro are pretty good but the difference that is evident is﻿ the CPU which was showed at 1.2GHZ and the 1080p  hd video. It's been months since any new news have been put out on it so hopefully they'll come out and surprise a lot of people with the S7 Pro
comments.author: Yngjust7

comments.text: Since it's considered "Pro" it's obviously a high end device and so far the Huawei products have been significantly cheaper than the competition but have if not﻿ the same specs, just a little bit behind. my friends have been swaying me away from this product but a)none of them actually tried one b)they have been going off of people bad mouthing Huawei products. i look at it like this, Apple products weren't that great a first but because of mass production and testing, they're good
comments.author: Yngjust7

comments.text: so basically people need to just Hauwei a chance so they can show the world what they're capable of doing. i'm really hoping that the S7 Slim is awesome because it's everything i'll need in a tablet. it would be nice if they(Huawei) released some photos or even a 50sec video teasing﻿ people to let everybody know that the S7 Pro is just as good if not better than the leading competitors of this tablet race
comments.author: Yngjust7

comments.text: Hi, thanks for your﻿ message. The S7 Slim will be released in the American market this month and yes it has a 3.2 mega-pixel camera.

comments.text: Hi, thanks for﻿ your interest in The IDEOS S7 Slim! The product will be available in the American market and in Italy via Wind this month. For Eastern Europe, it will be available in Austria and Romania, among others.

comments.text: Hi, glad you love our products. We will keep you updated on news of the IDEOS S7 Pro. Watch this﻿ space.

comments.text: Here in Serbia is 300 Euros. The best tablet around﻿ for that price.
comments.author: spljicna

comments.text: Bought one the day it was available and returned it less than 24 hours later. The speakers and﻿ screen sensitivity were great. But it wouldn't connect to the Android Market. Kept giving error messages. I recorded a short video and during playback, there was a horrible noise that seemed to be in sync with the time index bar that moves along as the video plays.  The microphone was terrible. I had to hold the unit inches from my mouth in order for my speech to be recognized, and I speak clearly.
comments.author: JoeRnCT

comments.text: So how can this be﻿ good for video chatting if the microphone barely picks up audio? Also had trouble getting a  GPS satellite lock. I really wanted to like this unit because it felt good in the hand and the price was really good. But there were just too many negatives about it so it wasn't worth keeping.
comments.author: JoeRnCT

comments.text: I brought this about 3 weeks ago because I thought that I could use it with my sim card for phone services. I can't seem to get my sim card in the slot that it is marked for. there is a black cloth-like thing there. Is this function available for this tablet or﻿ not? If so how do I get my sim card in there?
comments.author: James Johnson

comments.text: not only did﻿ she swipe to a picture of macaroni and laughed, but it also took FOREVER for the swipe to register. hilarious video.

comments.text: Can this android﻿ tab be converted to portrait mode?
comments.author: BoilingPointify

comments.text: I found an IDEOS S7 Silm in a pawn shop for $125 a few weeks ago. Best $125 I've spent all year. Have enjoyed this little tablet immensely. I couldn't imagine getting more enjoyment out of an iPad at 4x the price. It does everything﻿ I'd ever expect from a tablet. Flash video works perfectly. It's also built like a tank. Had the S7 in the passenger's seat hooked up listening to some tunes and had to brake a little hard. It went flying into the floorboard. Didn't even put a scratch on it.
comments.author: mohelidude

comments.text: If anyone is having problems accessing the Android Market﻿ with their S7 Slim... do a full system reset and let the tablet reload Android OS and all of the software automatically. It will connect to the Android Market flawlessly each and every time after that. This is a known issue.
comments.author: mohelidude

comments.text: @beliorlovicccc Hi there, yes, you can download﻿ Skype from the Android market.

comments.text: Hi there, thanks for the question. You can calibrate the orientation of the touchscreen﻿ motion by going to Settings > Display > Auto-rotate screen

comments.text: Hi Michael, thanks for the question. The IDEOS S7 Slim comes with a Qualcomm﻿ Snapdragon 1GHz processor. For more information on product specs, please visit our website at huaweidevice . com / worldwide
